row.PlainText: Getting Started The guide contains information about access to the system, personalization of the system according to your needs (such as configuration of your user profile, management of document processing, and configuration of your workspace), and description of system-wide actions that you can use during work with Acumatica ERP. This information helps you to configure the system according to your work tasks and, thus, make your work easy and comfortable. Overview of Your Personal Settings In Acumatica ERP, you can personalize your account, workspace, document processing, and data representation in ways to make using the system easier. You can specify your preferences for email signature, and dashboards. Other users will not be able to view your personal settings. Acumatica ERP provides you with standard actions that you can use on many forms (such as exporting tables to Excel workbooks and attaching files to records) or even anywhere in the system (such as searching). In this topic, you will read about various system-wide actions and ways of personalizing Acumatica ERP to your needs. Access to Acumatica ERPTo access the system, you identify yourself by typing your username and password when you sign in to the system. You can use your internal Acumatica ERP credentials, your domain credentials (if a system administrator of your organization has integrated Acumatica ERP with Active Directory), or your account credentials with an external identity provider, such as Google or Microsoft Account (if a system administrator of your organization has configured single sign-on with these providers). If you use Acumatica ERP credentials to access the system, your system administrator can allow you to change your password any time you want during your work with the system. If you forget your password or login, you can recover them if your system administrator has turned on this ability for you. Although it is a system administrator who initially fills in information about user accounts, you can change the parameters of your account without contacting the administrator. For example, you can specify or change your first and last name and your email address. You can sign in to different company branches (or even different companies) in different tabs of the same window or different windows of the same browser. After you finish working with the system, you should sign out to prevent unauthorized access to your account. For more information about access to Acumatica ERP, see Accessing an Acumatica ERP Instance. Settings of Your Working Environment Acumatica ERP provides you with tools for personalizing your working environment to make it more convenient for you. You can configure the following parameters: Time zone Locale settings (date, time, and number formats) Home page Favorite forms For details about settings of your working environment, see Managing Your Acumatica ERP Working Environment. Document Processing Settings In Acumatica ERP, you can set up certain parameters that affect your work with documents. If you have to sign PDF documents that you create in the system with a digital signature, you can use your personal certificate instead of the general certificate that is specified by your system administrator. If you send emails in Acumatica ERP, you may need to configure your signature, which you can do in your user profile. For more information, see Personalizing Document Processing. Personal Tasks and Events In the system, you can easily access tasks and events that were assigned to you. You can see the number of assigned tasks and events in the info area (for details, see Info Area in the Acumatica ERP Interface Guide) and open the ([~/?ScreenId=EP404000|EP404000]) Tasks (EP404000) or ([~/?ScreenId=EP404100|EP404100]) Events (EP404100) form for more details. If a reminder is configured for a task or event, you will be notified about the coming task or event in advance. For more information, see Managing Your Tasks and Events. Data Presentation Acumatica ERP stores and displays large data loads, and you may want to make this data convenient for view and analysis. To solve this task, you can filter data in reports and tables, and save filters for later usage. You also can adjust table view—for example, widen or constrict column widths and change column order. For details, see Personalizing the Presentation of Data . Personal Dashboards Multiple dashboards can be created in Acumatica ERP by your system administrator or other colleagues who have appropriate rights. You can personalize these dashboards to view exactly the information you need if your system administrator allowed you to do so. For more information, see Configuring Dashboards. Mobile Device Management If you are using the Acumatica mobile app, the information about the devices that allow push notifications from the app (within the settings of the particular mobile device) is stored in your Acumatica ERP user profile. The first time you sign in to the mobile app on a particular mobile device, the application sends details about your device to Acumatica ERP, and then the information is updated (if needed) with each subsequent sign-in. You can remove from the list of devices a device that you are no longer using or that you have lost. Also, you can control to which devices you allow the system to send push notifications. System-Wide Actions In Acumatica ERP, you can use standard actions that are available in multiple places of the system. If you need to, you can attach files (for example, scanned documents) and notes (for example, processing instructions for a document) to records. You can search for forms, help topics, or records if you want to quickly find these system entities. When you create new documents and objects in Acumatica ERP, you can fill in all document elements from scratch, copy and paste an existing document or object of the same type, or use a previously created template. The copy-and-paste options and templates make the creation process much easier for you and help you minimize input errors. When you work in Acumatica ERP, you may need to export data in formats that can be opened by external applications, such as Microsoft Excel. To solve this task, you can export data to Excel and CSV formats. The import operation from these formats is also supported. This support is useful, for example, when you have some data in Excel and want to load it in Acumatica ERP for further processing. If sometimes you need to transfer generic inquiries from one Acumatica ERP instance to another, you can use export and import of data in XML format. For more information about system-wide actions, see Using System-Wide Actions. User Interface Employees on different positions use different sets of forms in Acumatica ERP to perform their work tasks. You can configure the user interface so that forms and reports you use frequently are at hand. If your user role provides you with access to multiple functional areas (such as Payables, Receivables, and Sales Orders) but you use forms in particular areas more often than in other areas, you can configure workspaces in the main menu so that the system displays only frequently used workspaces there. Similarly, you can configure each workspace to which you have access. To the Quick Menu, you can add only forms that you use more often. For more information, see Personalizing the Modern User Interface. Documents Approval Your organization can reduce the time required for document assignment and routing because the system provides automatic assignment for all the required approvals. In Acumatica ERP the process of document approval can be enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features form. Acumatica ERP provides a single form, ([~/?ScreenId=EP503010|EP503010]) Approvals (EP503010), that can be used as a starting point for all documents that require approval. For more information, see Approving Documents.

row.PlainText: Accessing an Acumatica ERP Instance The first thing you do when you want to work with Acumatica ERP is signing in to the system. Because the financial information with which you work in Acumatica ERP is highly confidential, system administrators of your organization create user accounts and provide them with access rights. You can use one of these accounts to access the system. In this chapter, you will find information about access to Acumatica ERP. In This Chapter Access to Your Acumatica ERP InstanceTo Sign In and Sign OutTo Recover a Forgotten Password or a User NameTo Specify Your Password Recovery QuestionTo Change Your PasswordTo Activate Your Google or Microsoft Account

row.column: Access to Your Acumatica ERP Instance Information about the financial documents processed in each organization is confidential, so system administrators who deploy and support Acumatica ERP in your organization restrict access to the system by creating user accounts or integrating Acumatica ERP with external identity providers. For the full list of system settings available to you, see Overview of Your Personal Settings. In this topic, you will read about managing user account information, signing in and out of Acumatica ERP, recovering your credentials, and changing your password. Managing User Account Details As a user of Acumatica ERP, you have a separate user account that defines what forms you can access, what changes you can make, and what your personal settings are. Your user account contains the following: A login (username), which is managed by your system administrator A password Additional information about you, which you can manage without contacting your system administrator On the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SP203010) form, you can manage the following personal information: Your first name and last name. Your phone number. Your password. For details, see Changing the Password of Your Account Changing the Password of Your Account. Your email account. For information about how to configure your email account, see To Configure Your Email Account. Your password recovery question and answer. For details, see Recovering Your User Credentials Recovering Your User Credentials. If your Acumatica ERP instance is integrated with Active Directory, for domain users, some of the settings listed above are unavailable; they are set on the domain level in Active Directory. To open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile form, in the Info area (in the top right corner of the screen), click your username and select User Profile . Signing In and Signing Out When you want to work with Acumatica ERP, you need to sign in to the system—that is, to type your login and password so the system knows who you are and what access rights you have. Depending on how your system administrator has configured your account, it is one of the following: Acumatica ERP account: You use your login and password that the system administrator has created for you in Acumatica ERP to access the system. Domain account: If the system administrator has integrated Acumatica ERP with Microsoft Active Directory, you use your domain login and password (which you use to log in to your computer) to sign in to Acumatica ERP. Account of an external identity provider: If the system administrator has configured single sign-on with an external identity provider, such as Google or Microsoft Account, you use your credentials of this provider to sign in to Acumatica ERP. For details how to register your Google or Microsoft account, see To Activate Your Google or Microsoft Account. You can sign in to different company branches (or even different companies) in different tabs of the same window or different windows of the same browser. When you stop working with Acumatica ERP, you should sign out to prevent unauthorized access. For the procedures that describe how to sign in to Acumatica ERP and sign out of the system, see To Sign In and Sign Out. Changing the Password of Your Acumatica ERP Account Your system administrator can allow you to change the password of your Acumatica ERP account any time you want. The ability to change your own password is useful, for example, when you suspect that your account is being accessed without your consent. For details, see To Change Your Password. Recovering Your User Credentials If you use Acumatica ERP credentials to sign in to the system, your system administrator can allow you to recover your password and login. The recovery mechanism sends emails to the email address that is specified in your account information. For details about how to recover your credentials, see To Recover a Forgotten Password or a User Name. On the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form, you can specify a password recovery question, the answer to which you need to enter when you are recovering your password. With a password recovery question, you reduce a risk of hacking your user account. For a procedure, see To Specify Your Password Recovery Question. If you have forgetten your password from a domain account, you should contact your system administrator. If you have forgotten your password from an external identity account, you should use the password recovery tools of the external identity provider. ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010])

Performing this step signs you out on all browser tabs and windows that are running this branch of the company.

To Sign In and Sign Out When you work with Acumatica ERP, you sign in to the system before work and sign out of the system after you finish your work. In this topic, you will find information how to sign in to the system with an Acumatica ERP account and an external account, and how to sign out of the system. To Sign In with Acumatica ERP Account Open your browser. In the Address bar, type the URL of your Acumatica ERP instance, and press Enter. This opens the Welcome screen. In the My Username and My Password boxes, type your user name and password, respectively. Optional: In the Interface Language box, select the interface language and the locale settings you want to use. (This box appears only if your system administrator has added multiple locales in the system.) Click Sign In . By default, if you are inactive for more than one hour, you will be automatically signed out. You can sign in to different companies, different company branches, or both in different browser tabs or windows. For example, you can sign in to the Main branch of company A, the South branch of company A, and the East branch of company B in different tabs of the same browser window. To Sign In with External Identity Account To be able to sign in with your Google or Microsoft account, you must register the account with your Acumatica ERP instance. For details, see To Activate Your Google or Microsoft Account. Open your browser. In the Address bar, type the URL of your Acumatica ERP instance and press Enter. This opens the Acumatica ERP Welcome screen. Click one of the following icons (depending on an account you want to sign in with): Click the Google ( ) icon to sign in with your Google account. This opens the Google sign-in page, where you enter your Google email and password. Click the Microsoft account ( ) icon to sign in with your Microsoft account. This opens the Microsoft Account sign-in page, where you enter your Microsoft Account email and password. To Sign Out In the info area (in the upper-right corner of the screen), click your user name, and then click Sign Out . Performing this step signs you out on all browser tabs and windows that are running this branch of the company.

In this case, to recover your password, your user name, or both, contact your administrator. ))) ==To Recover Your Password==[anchor|#ol_bfr_kbs_d3] #On the Welcome screen, click '''Forgot Your Credentials?'''. #On the Password Recovery screen, type your username in the '''Your Username''' box. #Click '''Submit'''. #For further instructions, check your email, using the address specified for your account by you or your system administrator. #In the appropriate email, click the password recovery link. #:This opens the Welcome screen for password change. #In the '''New Password''' and '''Confirm Password''' boxes, type your new password. #If you specified a password recovery question, in the '''Your Answer''' box, type the answer to the question that you have specified in your user profile. #Click '''Sign in'''.
==To Recover Your User Name==[anchor|#ol_rrg_1cs_d3] #On the Welcome screen, click '''Forgot Your Credentials?'''. #On the Password Recovery screen, click '''Forgot your username?'''. #In the '''Enter your email address''' box of the User Recovery screen, type the email address specified for your account by you or your system administrator. #Click '''Submit'''. #Check your email for an email that includes your user name.

To Recover a Forgotten Password or a User Name You can recover your Acumatica ERP user name or password if password recovery is allowed by your company's security policy. If you sign in to Acumatica ERP by using your domain account, you cannot use the following procedure. In this case, to recover your password, your user name, or both, contact your administrator. To Recover Your Password On the Welcome screen, click Forgot Your Credentials? . On the Password Recovery screen, type your username in the Your Username box. Click Submit . For further instructions, check your email, using the address specified for your account by you or your system administrator. In the appropriate email, click the password recovery link. This opens the Welcome screen for password change. In the New Password and Confirm Password boxes, type your new password. If you specified a password recovery question, in the Your Answer box, type the answer to the question that you have specified in your user profile. Click Sign in . To Recover Your User Name On the Welcome screen, click Forgot Your Credentials? . On the Password Recovery screen, click Forgot your username? . In the Enter your email address box of the User Recovery screen, type the email address specified for your account by you or your system administrator. Click Submit . Check your email for an email that includes your user name.

To Specify Your Password Recovery Question If password recovery is allowed per your company's security policy, you can specify a password recovery question and answer on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form to be used if you forget the password and need to securely acquire a new one. For more information about password recovery, see Access to Your Acumatica ERP Instance. In this topic, you will read how to specify your password recovery question. To Specify Your Password Recovery Question In the Info area, click your user name and select User Profile . Open the General Info tab. In the Password Recovery Question box, type the password recovery question. Click Change Answer . In the Change Password Recovery Answer dialog box, which opens, type the answer to the recovery question and your password. On the form toolbar, click Save . You can use the same procedure when you want to change the question or the answer.

You can change your password when you want to if your organization’s security policies allow this. You use the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) form to change your password, as described in this topic. ==To Change Your Password==[anchor|#ol_yss_nfg_zl] #In the Info area, click your user name, and select '''User Profile'''. #Open the '''General Info''' tab. #Click '''Change Password''' to open the '''Change Password''' dialog box. #Enter your old password and new password, and retype the new password to confirm it. #Click '''OK''' to change the password. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.
The next time you sign in to the system, you should use your new password.
row.PlainText: To Change Your Password You can change your password when you want to if your organization's security policies allow this. You use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form to change your password, as described in this topic. To Change Your Password In the Info area, click your user name, and select User Profile . Open the General Info tab. Click Change Password to open the Change Password dialog box. Enter your old password and new password, and retype the new password to confirm it. Click OK to change the password. On the form toolbar, click Save . The next time you sign in to the system, you should use your new password.

To be able to sign in to your Acumatica ERP instance with your Google or Microsoft account, you have to activate the applicable account in Acumatica ERP, as described in this topic. ==To Activate SSO with an Identity Provider==[anchor|#ol_dmd_3gn_w4] #Sign in to Acumatica ERP. #In the Info area in the top right corner of the screen, click your user name and then click '''User Profile'''. #If you want to be able to sign in with Google account, do the following: ##On the '''External Identities''' tab, click the ''Google'' row in the table. ##Make sure that the '''Active''' check box is selected. ##On the table toolbar, click '''Associate User'''. ##:This opens the Google sign-in page, where you must enter your Google email address and password. After you pass the authentication, the user key of your Google account is registered with your Acumatica ERP user account. #If you want to be able to sign in with Microsoft account, do the following: ##On the '''External Identities''' tab, click the ''Microsoft Account'' row in the table. ##Make sure that the '''Active''' check box is selected. ##On the table toolbar, click '''Associate User'''. ##:This opens the Microsoft Account sign-in page, where you must enter your Microsoft Account email address and password. After you pass the authentication, the user key of your Microsoft account is registered with your Acumatica ERP user account.
After you perform these steps, you can sign in to your Acumatica ERP instance with the account you registered. For details, see [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\Login_and_Logout__how_Log_in|To Sign In and Sign Out].

To Activate Your Google or Microsoft Account To be able to sign in to your Acumatica ERP instance with your Google or Microsoft account, you have to activate the applicable account in Acumatica ERP, as described in this topic. To Activate SSO with an Identity Provider Sign in to Acumatica ERP. In the Info area in the top right corner of the screen, click your user name and then click User Profile . If you want to be able to sign in with Google account, do the following: On the External Identities tab, click the Google row in the table. Make sure that the Active check box is selected. On the table toolbar, click Associate User . This opens the Google sign-in page, where you must enter your Google email address and password. After you pass the authentication, the user key of your Google account is registered with your Acumatica ERP user account. If you want to be able to sign in with Microsoft account, do the following: On the External Identities tab, click the Microsoft Account row in the table. Make sure that the Active check box is selected. On the table toolbar, click Associate User . This opens the Microsoft Account sign-in page, where you must enter your Microsoft Account email address and password. After you pass the authentication, the user key of your Microsoft account is registered with your Acumatica ERP user account. After you perform these steps, you can sign in to your Acumatica ERP instance with the account you registered. For details, see To Sign In and Sign Out.

row.PlainText: Managing Your Acumatica ERP Working Environment In Acumatica ERP, you can configure your working environment to reflect your country settings, such as time zone and date and number formats. You can also organize your working environment to best fit your job duties and preferences by specifying a home page and adding favorites. This chapter contains information about settings of your working environment. In This Chapter Settings of Your Acumatica ERP Working EnvironmentTo Select Your Time ZoneTo Select Your Locale SettingsTo Define Your Home PageTo Change the Business DateTo Add, Remove, and Open FavoritesTo Organize Your Favorites

row.column: Settings of Your Acumatica ERP Working Environment In Acumatica ERP, you can personalize your account in ways to make it easier to use the system. Your personal settings will be available only to you; other users will not be affected. For a more comprehensive description of the system settings available to you, see Overview of Your Personal Settings. This topic describes the settings that you can specify to configure your working environment in Acumatica ERP. Settings of Your Working Environment You can specify the following settings for your Acumatica ERP working environment: The time zone used for displaying times in the system. For more information, see To Select Your Time Zone. The date and time formats and the numbering format to be used for your user account. For details, see To Select Your Locale Settings. The home page you want to be displayed when you sign in to the system, as described in To Define Your Home Page. The list of your favorites, which are the forms that you access most frequently. For information about how to manage and organize favorites, see To Add, Remove, and Open Favorites and To Organize Your Favorites. The list of devices that you have use d to access the Acumatica ERP mobile app that allow push notifications to be received . For more information, see To Remove a Mobile Device and To Manage the Receipt of Push Notifications.

The time in Acumatica ERP is displayed based on your individual settings on the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) form. Time zones are specified with respect to GMT (Greenwich Meridian Time).{br}
If you do not specify a time zone on this form, the system uses the time zone of the calendar associated with your employee account, or of the calendar associated with your employee class. If you set a time zone, the timestamps of all documents will be expressed in the selected time zone. ==To Select Your Time Zone==[anchor|#ol_xfn_plx_xl] #In the Info area, click your user name and select '''User Profile'''. #On the '''General Settings''' tab ('''Personal Settings''' section) of the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] form, select the time zone you want to use. Do the following: #*To select your own time zone, select your time zone in the '''Time Zone''' box. #*To return to the default time zone of your Acumatica ERP instance, click '''Reset to Default Time Zone'''. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.

To Select Your Time Zone The time in Acumatica ERP is displayed based on your individual settings on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form. Time zones are specified with respect to GMT (Greenwich Meridian Time). If you do not specify a time zone on this form, the system uses the time zone of the calendar associated with your employee account, or of the calendar associated with your employee class. If you set a time zone, the timestamps of all documents will be expressed in the selected time zone. To Select Your Time Zone In the Info area, click your user name and select User Profile . On the General Settings tab ( Personal Settings section) of the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile form, select the time zone you want to use. Do the following: To select your own time zone, select your time zone in the Time Zone box. To return to the default time zone of your Acumatica ERP instance, click Reset to Default Time Zone . On the form toolbar, click Save .

row.Content: In Acumatica ERP, you can specify your country settings, such as date, time, and number format (as described in this topic), so that correct data are applied when you create documents in the system. ==To Select Your Locale Settings==[anchor|#ul_lrs_fpv_nk] #In the Info area, click your user name and then click '''User Profile''' to open the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) form. #In the '''Format''' box of the '''Custom Locale Format''' tab, select the locale whose format settings you want to use for your user account. This fills in the parameters of the locale in the '''Date and Time Formats''' and '''Number Format''' sections. #Optional: Change the settings in the '''Date and Time Formats''' and '''Number Format''' sections. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.
row.PlainText: To Select Your Locale Settings In Acumatica ERP, you can specify your country settings, such as date, time, and number format (as described in this topic), so that correct data are applied when you create documents in the system. To Select Your Locale Settings In the Info area, click your user name and then click User Profile to open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form. In the Format box of the Custom Locale Format tab, select the locale whose format settings you want to use for your user account. This fills in the parameters of the locale in the Date and Time Formats and Number Format sections. Optional: Change the settings in the Date and Time Formats and Number Format sections. On the form toolbar, click Save .

row.column:
The home page is the first page you see when you sign in to the Acumatica ERP website. By default, the home page displays the default shared dashboard with the online documentation list. You can configure your home page to display one of the following:[anchor|#ul_cfw_pq3_4k] *A module dashboard: The selected module dashboard is copied to the home page. You can customize this dashboard to give you exactly the information you need at a glance. On dashboards, different types of information can be displayed in various presentation forms, such as text, charts, graphs, or tables, depending on your preferences and the type of data you want to see. For more information, see [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\GS__mng_Dashboards|Configuring Dashboards]. *A form: You can specify a particular form as your home page. When you sign in, the system opens the form and uses it as the home page.
You use the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) form to select what you want to see on your home page. ==To Define Your Home Page==[anchor|#ol_c14_153_4k] #In the Info area, click your user name, and select '''User Profile'''. #In the '''Home Page''' box of the '''General Settings''' tab ('''Personal Settings''' section), do one of the following: #*Select a module from the site tree to use its module dashboard as a home page. #*Select a form from the site tree to be used as home page. #*Leave the box blank to use the default shared dashboard as your home page. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.
To open the home page, click the Acumatica ERP banner in the upper-left corner of the main menu.

To Define Your Home Page The home page is the first page you see when you sign in to the Acumatica ERP website. By default, the home page displays the default shared dashboard with the online documentation list. You can configure your home page to display one of the following: A module dashboard: The selected module dashboard is copied to the home page. You can customize this dashboard to give you exactly the information you need at a glance. On dashboards, different types of information can be displayed in various presentation forms, such as text, charts, graphs, or tables, depending on your preferences and the type of data you want to see. For more information, see Configuring Dashboards. A form: You can specify a particular form as your home page. When you sign in, the system opens the form and uses it as the home page. You use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form to select what you want to see on your home page. To Define Your Home Page In the Info area, click your user name, and select User Profile . In the Home Page box of the General Settings tab ( Personal Settings section), do one of the following: Select a module from the site tree to use its module dashboard as a home page. Select a form from the site tree to be used as home page. Leave the box blank to use the default shared dashboard as your home page. On the form toolbar, click Save . To open the home page, click the Acumatica ERP banner in the upper-left corner of the main menu.

The business date is the date that appears by default on Acumatica ERP forms and on documents that you create by using the forms. {br}
By default, all users can change the business date in the system. If the ''Secure Business Date'' feature is enabled on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\CS_10_00_00|Enable/Disable Features] ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) form, only users with the ''BusinessDateOverride'' role assigned to them can change the business date. If the ''Secure Business Date'' feature is disabled, or if the ''BusinessDateOverride'' role is assigned to you when the ''Secure Business Date'' feature is enabled, you can change the business date, as described in this topic. ==To Change the Business Date== [anchor|#_hrd_grq_mg] #In the info area, in the upper-right corner of the Acumatica ERP screen, click '''Business Date'''. #In the '''Business Date''' box, type the date or click the arrow to select the date by using the calendar. #Click '''OK'''.
row.column: To Change the Business Date The business date is the date that appears by default on Acumatica ERP forms and on documents that you create by using the forms. By default, all users can change the business date in the system. If the Secure Business Date feature is enabled on the ([~/?ScreenId=CS100000|CS100000]) Enable/Disable Features (CS100000) form, only users with the BusinessDateOverride role assigned to them can change the business date. If the Secure Business Date feature is disabled, or if the BusinessDateOverride role is assigned to you when the Secure Business Date feature is enabled, you can change the business date, as described in this topic. To Change the Business Date In the info area, in the upper-right corner of the Acumatica ERP screen, click Business Date . In the Business Date box, type the date or click the arrow to select the date by using the calendar. Click OK .

In Acumatica ERP, you can define the forms you use most frequently as your favorites, to give you easy access to them. In this topic, you will find procedures that describe how to add, remove, and open your favorites. ==To Add a Form to Your Favorites==[anchor|#ol_qpv_fnb_m3] #Open the form that you want to add to your favorites. #On the form title bar, right of the form title, click '''Add to Favorites''' ([image:UserGuide/Images/form_title_bar_favorites.png|16px]).
Now the form is available in the '''Favorites''' list. ==To Remove a Form from Favorites==[anchor|#ol_q53_r1z_p3] #Open the form that you want to remove from favorites. #On the form title bar, right of the form title, click '''Remove from Favorites''' ([image:UserGuide/Images/form_title_bar_favorites_remove.png|16px]).
==To Open a Favorite==[anchor|#ol_r3y_bcz_p3] #On the left side of the main menu, click '''Favorites''' ([image:UserGuide/Images/main_menu_favorites.png|16px]). #In the navigation pane, in the list of your favorites, click the name of the form you want to open. ((({S:Hint}You need to add at least one form to your favorites to see the '''Favorites''' ([anchor|#image_bkj_z25_pk][image:UserGuide/Images/main_menu_favorites.png|16px]) button on the main menu. )))You can organize the favorites that you have added, as described in [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\Favorites__how_Organize|To Organize Your Favorites].

To Add, Remove, and Open Favorites In Acumatica ERP, you can define the forms you use most frequently as your favorites, to give you easy access to them. In this topic, you will find procedures that describe how to add, remove, and open your favorites. To Add a Form to Your Favorites Open the form that you want to add to your favorites. On the form title bar, right of the form title, click Add to Favorites ( ). Now the form is available in the Favorites list. To Remove a Form from Favorites Open the form that you want to remove from favorites. On the form title bar, right of the form title, click Remove from Favorites ( ). To Open a Favorite On the left side of the main menu, click Favorites ( ). In the navigation pane, in the list of your favorites, click the name of the form you want to open. You need to add at least one form to your favorites to see the Favorites ( ) button on the main menu. You can organize the favorites that you have added, as described in To Organize Your Favorites.

After you have added favorites, you may need to organize the list to make it more convenient to use. You can organize your list of favorites by using the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_20|User Favorites] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203020|SM203020]) form. To open this form, perform one of the following instructions:[anchor|#ul_y53_g2s_y3] *On the main menu (top left), click the '''Favorites''' ([image:UserGuide/Images/main_menu_favorites.png|16px]) button, and then click '''Favorites''' at the top of the navigation pane (above the Search box). *In the info area (upper right corner of the Acumatica ERP screen), click your user name, and then click '''Organize Favorites'''.
In this topic, you will find information about different ways to organize your favorites. ==To Rename a Favorite or a Folder of Favorites==[anchor|#ol_vfv_dgs_y3] #In the Tree pane, click the folder that contains the favorite. #In the table (right pane), double-click the favorite, and edit the name in the '''Title''' column. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.
==To Change the Order of Favorites==[anchor|#ol_lfz_3hs_y3] #In the Tree pane, click the folder that contains the favorites. #In the table (right pane), select the favorite. On the table toolbar, click '''Move Node Up''' or '''Move Node Down''' to change the position of the favorite in the list. Click these buttons until the favorite is in the needed location. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.
==To Create a Folder==[anchor|#ol_lxn_mbj_4k] #In the Tree pane, click the folder that you want to contain the new folder. #On the table toolbar (right pane), click '''Add Row'''. #In the '''Title''' column of the new row, type the folder title. #Click any other table row. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.
==To Move a Favorite Into or Out of a Folder==[anchor|#ol_usj_lgs_y3] #In the Tree pane, click the favorite. #On the toolbar of the Tree pane, click '''Move One Level Down''' to move the favorite into the folder or '''Move One Level Up''' to move the favorite out of the folder. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.
==To Make a Node Expand and Display Links When You Open Favorites==[anchor|#ol_srb_bhs_y3] #In the Tree pane, click the folder that contains the favorite. #In the table (right pane), select the '''Expanded''' check box in the row of the favorite. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.
==To Delete a Link or a Folder==[anchor|#ol_mxm_dhs_y3] #In the Tree pane, select the folder that contains the favorite. #In the table (right pane), click the favorite and click '''Delete Row'''. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''. For information on how to add or delete favorites, see [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\GS__how_Manage_Favorites|To Add, Remove, and Open Favorites]

To Organize Your Favorites After you have added favorites, you may need to organize the list to make it more convenient to use. You can organize your list of favorites by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203020|SM203020]) User Favorites (SM203020) form. To open this form, perform one of the following instructions: On the main menu (top left), click the Favorites ( ) button, and then click Favorites at the top of the navigation pane (above the Search box). In the info area (upper right corner of the Acumatica ERP screen), click your user name, and then click Organize Favorites . In this topic, you will find information about different ways to organize your favorites. To Rename a Favorite or a Folder of Favorites In the Tree pane, click the folder that contains the favorite. In the table (right pane), double-click the favorite, and edit the name in the Title column. On the form toolbar, click Save . To Change the Order of Favorites In the Tree pane, click the folder that contains the favorites. In the table (right pane), select the favorite. On the table toolbar, click Move Node Up or Move Node Down to change the position of the favorite in the list. Click these buttons until the favorite is in the needed location. On the form toolbar, click Save . To Create a Folder In the Tree pane, click the folder that you want to contain the new folder. On the table toolbar (right pane), click Add Row . In the Title column of the new row, type the folder title. Click any other table row. On the form toolbar, click Save . To Move a Favorite Into or Out of a Folder In the Tree pane, click the favorite. On the toolbar of the Tree pane, click Move One Level Down to move the favorite into the folder or Move One Level Up to move the favorite out of the folder. On the form toolbar, click Save . To Make a Node Expand and Display Links When You Open Favorites In the Tree pane, click the folder that contains the favorite. In the table (right pane), select the Expanded check box in the row of the favorite. On the form toolbar, click Save . To Delete a Link or a Folder In the Tree pane, select the folder that contains the favorite. In the table (right pane), click the favorite and click Delete Row . On the form toolbar, click Save . For information on how to add or delete favorites, see To Add, Remove, and Open Favorites

You may need to remove a device from the list of devices you use to access the Acumatica mobile app. For example, suppose that you have a new device and do not plan to use the old one, or that you have lost a mobile device that you previously used. ((({S:Hint}On the '''Devices''' tab of the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) form, the system registers only devices that allow the receipt of push notifications from the Acumatica mobile app. ))) You use the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] form to manage the list of your devices. ==To Remove a Mobile Device==[anchor|#ol_xfn_plx_xl] #In the Info area of Acumatica ERP, click your user name, and select '''User Profile'''. #On the '''Devices''' tab of the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) form, which is opened, remove the mobile device from the table by using the '''Delete''' button on the table toolbar. For the list of standard buttons, see [HelpRoot_Interface\Details_Toolbar|Table Toolbar]. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.

To Remove a Mobile Device You may need to remove a device from the list of devices you use to access the Acumatica mobile app. For example, suppose that you have a new device and do not plan to use the old one, or that you have lost a mobile device that you previously used. On the Devices tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form, the system registers only devices that allow the receipt of push notifications from the Acumatica mobile app. You use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile form to manage the list of your devices. To Remove a Mobile Device In the Info area of Acumatica ERP, click your user name, and select User Profile . On the Devices tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form, which is opened, remove the mobile device from the table by using the Delete button on the table toolbar. For the list of standard buttons, see Table Toolbar. On the form toolbar, click Save .

You can control to which devices, among those you have used to sign in to the Acumatica mobile app, you would like the system to send you push notifications. For example, suppose that you have a new device and have decided to use both of your devices temporarily to make sure that you have transferred all the needed information to the new device. To avoid receiving push notifications to both devices simultaneously, you can turn off the receipt of push notifications for one of your devices. ((({S:Hint}On the '''Devices''' tab of the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) form, the system lists only devices that allow the receipt of push notifications from the Acumatica ERP mobile app. ))) You use the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] form to manage the receipt of push notifications on your registered mobile devices. ==To Manage the Receipt of Push Notifications==[anchor|#ol_xfn_plx_xl] #In the Info area of Acumatica ERP, click your user name, and select '''User Profile'''. #On the '''Devices''' tab of the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) form, which opens, you can do one of the following for each registered mobile device listed: #*To allow the system to send push notifications to this mobile device, you select the '''Turn on Notifications''' check box for the device. #*To forbid the system to send push notifications to this mobile device, you clear the'''Turn on Notifications''' check box for the device. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.

To Manage the Receipt of Push Notifications You can control to which devices, among those you have used to sign in to the Acumatica mobile app, you would like the system to send you push notifications. For example, suppose that you have a new device and have decided to use both of your devices temporarily to make sure that you have transferred all the needed information to the new device. To avoid receiving push notifications to both devices simultaneously, you can turn off the receipt of push notifications for one of your devices. On the Devices tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form, the system lists only devices that allow the receipt of push notifications from the Acumatica ERP mobile app. You use the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile form to manage the receipt of push notifications on your registered mobile devices. To Manage the Receipt of Push Notifications In the Info area of Acumatica ERP, click your user name, and select User Profile . On the Devices tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form, which opens, you can do one of the following for each registered mobile device listed: To allow the system to send push notifications to this mobile device, you select the Turn on Notifications check box for the device. To forbid the system to send push notifications to this mobile device, you clear the Turn on Notifications check box for the device. On the form toolbar, click Save .

row.PlainText: Personalizing Document Processing Acumatica ERP provides you with ways to personalize the processing of documents. You can specify your certificate for signing PDF documents and set up a signature for your emails. In this chapter, you will find information about configuring document processing. In This Chapter Personal Settings for Document ProcessingTo Configure Your Email AccountTo Select Your Personal Certificate

row.column: Personal Settings for Document Processing When you process documents, you may want to apply your personal settings. For example, you may want to sign all PDF files you export from the system with your personal digital signature. In Acumatica ERP, you can specify personal settings for documents exported to Microsoft Excel and for emails that you send from the system. For a description of the system settings available to you, see Overview of Your Personal Settings. In this topic, you will read about personalizing settings for document processing. Email Settings Your personal email account is specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201010|SM201010]) Users (SM201010) form by a system administrator who creates user accounts. You can view and change it on the General Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form. If you need to send emails from Acumatica ERP, you can configure your signature that will be automatically added to each email. You can create your signature on the Email Settings tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile form. On the same tab, you can select the system email account that will be used as the default email account when you send emails through Acumatica ERP. Incoming emails and replies to mass emails will be automatically sorted by the system and routed to your personal email account. For details about how to configure your email account, see To Configure Your Email Account. For more information about using the email functionality in Acumatica ERP, see Managing Emails. Personal Certificate If you are authorized to generate PDF files, you can specify your personal certificate for signing these files. If you do not specify a personal certificate, files will be signed with the default PDF certificate specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201060|SM201060]) Security Preferences (SM201060) form. You can select a certificate only from the list of certificates available in the system. An administrator or other authorized person should upload the required certificates in advance by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SM200530|SM200530]) Encryption Certificates (SM200530) form. For a procedure that describes how to specify your personal certificate, see To Select Your Personal Certificate. ([~/?ScreenId=SM200530|SM200530]) ([~/?ScreenId=SM201060|SM201060]) ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) ([~/?ScreenId=SM201010|SM201010])

To Configure Your Email Account Your personal email address is specified on the General Info tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form. If you need to send emails from Acumatica ERP, you can configure your signature, which will be automatically added to each email. You can create your signature by using the Email Settings tab of this form. On the same tab, you can select the system email account that will be used as the default email account when you send emails through Acumatica ERP. The system will automatically sort incoming emails and replies to mass emails and route them to your personal email account. This topic describes how to change your email address in your profile and how to configure your email account. To Change Your Email Address Defined in the System In the Info area, click your user name and then click User Profile . On the General Info tab, click Change Email right of the Email box to open the Change Email dialog box. In the New Email box, enter your new personal email address. In the Password box, type your password. Click OK to change your email address. To Configure Your Email Account In the Info area, click your user name and select User Profile . Open the Email Settings tab. In the Default Email Account box, select the system email address that will be used by the system for sending emails on your behalf. If you want to make your calendar visible to other users, select the Is Public Calendar check box. If you want to enter a signature for emails, in the User Email Signature section, do the following: Select the Include in New Emails check box if you want to insert the signature in each new email that you send by using Acumatica ERP. Select the Include in Replies and Forwarded Emails check box, if you want to insert the signature when you reply to or forward emails. In the text editor area, enter your signature for emails. On the form toolbar, click Save .

If you are authorized to generate PDF files, you can specify your personal certificate for signing PDF files, as described in this topic. If you do not specify a personal certificate, files will be signed with the default PDF certificate specified on the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_10_60|Security Preferences] ([~/?ScreenId=SM201060|SM201060]) form. For more information about the configuration of document processing parameters, see [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\GS__mng_Personal_Document_Processing|Personalizing Document Processing]. ==Before You Begin== You should ask your system administrator or another authorized person to upload the certificate you will use as your personal certificate to the system by using the [HelpRoot_FormReference\SM_20_05_30|Encryption Certificates] ([~/?ScreenId=SM200530|SM200530]) form. ==To Select Your Personal Certificate== [anchor|#ol_phy_b43_qk] #In the Info area, click your user name and then click '''User Profile''' to open the [HelpRoot_GettingStarted\SM_20_30_10|User Profile] ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) form. #Open the '''General Info''' tab. #In the '''PDF Signing Certificate''' box of the '''Personal Settings''' section, select your certificate. #On the form toolbar, click '''Save'''.

To Select Your Personal Certificate If you are authorized to generate PDF files, you can specify your personal certificate for signing PDF files, as described in this topic. If you do not specify a personal certificate, files will be signed with the default PDF certificate specified on the ([~/?ScreenId=SM201060|SM201060]) Security Preferences (SM201060) form. For more information about the configuration of document processing parameters, see Personalizing Document Processing. Before You Begin You should ask your system administrator or another authorized person to upload the certificate you will use as your personal certificate to the system by using the ([~/?ScreenId=SM200530|SM200530]) Encryption Certificates (SM200530) form. To Select Your Personal Certificate In the Info area, click your user name and then click User Profile to open the ([~/?ScreenId=SM203010|SM203010]) User Profile (SM203010) form. Open the General Info tab. In the PDF Signing Certificate box of the Personal Settings section, select your certificate. On the form toolbar, click Save .

row.PlainText: Managing Your Tasks and Events You can use Acumatica ERP to organize your everyday work. That is, you can add tasks and events and manage them by using the system tools. To work efficiently, you should have easy access to the list of your tasks and events. In Acumatica ERP, you can view the number of active tasks and events in the info area in the upper-right corner of the form. (For details, see Info Area in the Interface Guide.) For important tasks and events, you can add reminders. This chapter describes how you can manage your tasks, events, and reminders. In This Chapter Your Tasks and Events Task ManagementNotifications About EventsTo Set Up Reminders for Tasks and Events

row.column: Your Tasks and Events To make your work more effective, Acumatica ERP provides you with tools that help you to organize your tasks and events, which you can create and manage in the system. In this topic, you will read about accessing your tasks and events, and adding reminders. Your Tasks and Events The My Tasks and Events menu, located in the info area (upper-right corner of the screen; see Info Area in the Interface Guide), offers you a quick way to access the ([~/?ScreenId=EP404000|EP404000]) Tasks (EP404000) and ([~/?ScreenId=EP404100|EP404100]) Events (EP404100) forms. The My Tasks and Events menu appears on the screen if the functionality is enabled for your Acumatica ERP instance by your system administrator. For details, see To Turn On the My Tasks and Events Button in the Acumatica ERP Installation Guide. The My Tasks and Events menu button displays the total number of active tasks and events assigned to the current user, with a value in parentheses that indicates the number of new tasks and events. The numbers of new tasks and events are also displayed separately in the Tasks and Events command names. The system updates the information displayed on the My Tasks and Events menu every 10 seconds, so you can view the most current information about your tasks and events. A new task or event created in the system causes the following values to increase: The total value (if you added the task or event) Both the total and new values (if the task or event was added by any other means) For details about work with tasks, see Keeping Track of Your Tasks Keeping Track of Your Tasks. For more information about events, see Keeping Track of Your Events Keeping Track of Your Events. For an important task or event, you can configure a reminder. In this case, for affected users, the Reminder button in the info area will blink at the time you specify, and the Reminder dialog box will appear (for details, see Reminder Dialog Box), informing them about all tasks and events that require their attention. For more information about reminders, see Using Reminders Using Reminders. Keeping Track of Your Tasks The ([~/?ScreenId=EP404000|EP404000]) Tasks (EP404000) form displays the list of tasks assigned to you. By using this form, you can view tasks, drill down to the details of a task, and complete or cancel a task. To open the ([~/?ScreenId=EP404000|EP404000]) Tasks form, do the following: On the My Tasks and Events menu, click Tasks . The ([~/?ScreenId=EP404000|EP404000]) Tasks form displays the tasks you have created and all the tasks in your scope. For more information, see Task Tracking Options Task Tracking Options. Depending on the default filter set for the form (if one has been set), you may see all active tasks or the most urgent ones. If a filter has been used, the filter name appears in the Select Filter box on the table toolbar (upper right). For more information about filters, see Personalizing the Presentation of Data . You can click any task in the list to view or edit the details of the task. For more information, see Task Management. Keeping Track of Your Events An event is an activity with a specific starting time and duration. The ([~/?ScreenId=EP404100|EP404100]) Events (EP404100) form displays all events associated with your user name. By using this form, you can do the following: View events Drill down to the details of an event Complete an event Cancel an event Export an event or your entire calendar with all events To open the ([~/?ScreenId=EP404100|EP404100]) Events form, do the following: On the My Tasks and Events menu, click Events . Depending on the filter set for the form (if one has been set), you might see all active events or only specific ones. If a filter has been applied to the list of events, the Select Filter box on the table toolbar (upper right) displays the filter name. You can click any event in the list to view or edit the details of the event. For more information, see Notifications About Events. Using Reminders In Acumatica ERP, you can set reminders to alert yourself and other users about tasks and events that require attention or are overdue. Before you can start using reminders, you must ask your system administrator to enable the reminder functionality. For more information, see To Turn On Reminders in the Acumatica ERP Installation Guide. You can set up reminders for a task or an event, as described in To Set Up Reminders for Tasks and Events. At the time you have specified, the Reminder dialog box for the activated task or event will appear on the Acumatica ERP page you are using. You can cause the reminder to snooze (disappear and then reappear at a later time) or dismiss the task or event. Additionally, you can view the "snoozing" tasks and events in the Reminders dialog box which you can open by clicking the Reminder ( ) button in the info area. For more information about Reminder and Reminders dialog boxes, see Reminder Dialog Box and Reminders Dialog Box. ([~/?ScreenId=EP204040|EP204040]) ([~/?ScreenId=EP404100|EP404100]) ([~/?ScreenId=EP404000|EP404000])

Task Management With the task management capabilities of Acumatica ERP, you can keep personal to-do lists, configure reminders for all tasks or only the most important ones, track tasks assigned to you, create tasks, assign tasks to other users, and follow up on tasks assigned to others. These capabilities help you do the right things at the right time, so you can improve your performance and efficiency. Tasks Each task has a creator and an assignee : The task's creator is the employee who created the task, and its assignee is the employee to whom the task is assigned. (The creator and assignee may be the same employee.) A task should be assigned before it is saved. Tasks can be created as associated with no specific entity, or they can be created as associated with any of the following entities: leads, contacts, opportunities, business accounts, cases, employees, and projects. You can create such an association by using one of the following methods: Specifying a related entity by using the ([~/?ScreenId=CR306020|CR306020]) Task (CR306020) form when you create a new task or adjust an existing one Creating a task by using the Activities tab on the corresponding data entry form. For instance, to create a task that will be associated with a certain case, you would use this tab on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR306000|CR306000]) Cases (CR306000) form. When creating a task, the creator can configure a reminder for it and specify on what day before the due date the assignee should receive the reminder. On the specified date, the reminder will appear in the info area of the assignee's screen and will be blinking or highlighted in red until either of the users, the creator or the assignee, completes the task or changes its status. Before you can start using reminders, you must ask your system administrator to enable the reminder functionality. For more information, see To Turn On Reminders in the Acumatica ERP Installation Guide. Task Tracking Options You can view the total number of your tasks and events, including the new ones, in the info area at the top of any Acumatica ERP form. The Tasks link opens the ([~/?ScreenId=EP404000|EP404000]) Tasks (EP404000) form. By using this form, you can view the following tasks: Those you have created. If these tasks are assigned to other users, you might want to track them to see whether they are being fulfilled (and what related activities have been created for the tasks). Such tasks are displayed on the Follow-Up Tasks tab of the ([~/?ScreenId=EP404000|EP404000]) Tasks (EP404000) form. Those assigned to the users in your workgroup. Escalated tasks assigned to users of workgroups that are positioned, in the company tree, on levels lower than your workgroup but in the same node. You can hide a task, event, or other activity from external users by marking it Internal on the ([~/?ScreenId=CR306020|CR306020]) Task (CR306020), ([~/?ScreenId=CR306030|CR306030]) Event (CR306030), or ([~/?ScreenId=CR306010|CR306010]) Activity (CR306010) form, respectively. To make the most important tasks noticeable to you at a glance, you can use the ([~/?ScreenId=EP204040|EP204040]) Event and Task Categories (EP204040) form to associate different colors with different categories of tasks. For example, if you select red for the most important tasks, yellow for less important tasks, and green for normal tasks, you will see the tasks marked by exclamation marks (in the column with the ! heading) highlighted with the respective colors. Tasks do not require approvals; they are completed by the assignees or canceled by the creators.
